hanzi-su-wiki:
鈍

Значения

Тупой; тусклый; ослабевать

Мнемоника

Инструмент из металла 金, к которому приложили большие усилия 屯, и он затупился.

Варианты

钝

heisig_constituent: dull, metal, gold, earthworm, drop, shovel, fishhook
koohiiStory1: The metal hook is too dull to even pierce an earthworm....
koohiiStory2: From the earthworm´s perspective, it most be pretty dull when you are put in a metal bowl, just waiting for being put on the hook on the fishing trip the next day.
kunYomi: にぶ.い、にぶ.る、にぶ-、なま.る、なまく.ら
jp_example_words:
鈍感(どんかん): thickheadedness, stolidity
鈍る(なまる): to become less capable, to grow dull, to become blunt, to weaken
鈍い(にぶい): dull (e.g. a knife), thickheaded, slow, stupid
鈍い(のろい): dull (e.g. a knife), thickheaded, slow, stupid
jp_readingExamples: 鈍い (にぶ.い), 鈍る (にぶ.る)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Make barracks out of gold and they will get dull quickly. Gold is soft, it's okay for jewelry and delicate things that aren't used much, but barracks for soldiers? Those are used constantly, and they get worn out easily. What was once shiny gold will go dull in days.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture a huge barracks made of dull, almost brown, gold. Maybe you should have picked a better material.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As you stare sadly at the dull barracks, the don (どん) shows up out of nowhere, and he's pissed. He turns his angry gaze toward you and says, "How did my barracks get so dull? Are you at fault? This is bad, this is very bad. Someone will pay for this."
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You stand cowering in front of the don as he inspects how dull the gold barracks are. You don't wanna be off'd for this just because the don was dull enough to make you use gold!
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the gold (金) in the barracks (屯) is dull
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " gold " and " tun ", the original meaning is (sword) not sharp. "Shuowen": "Yeye. From Jin to Tunsheng." "Han Feizi·Xianxue": "Water hits the geese, and Lu breaks the horse, and then Zang gains unquestioned blunt profits."

" Dull " can also mean dullness and clumsiness. "Han Shu·Bao Propaganda": "Chen Xuan Na is blunt in his speech, and it's too terrifying, just dead.

" Dull " is also used for failure and unsuccessfulness. Han Yangxiong's "Fayan‧ Five Hundreds": "The more profitable the people, the more blunt, and the more blunt the saint, the more profitable.

Plain speech can also be called " blunt ". The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long·Ming Zhen": "Wei Wen Nine Treasures, sharp tools and blunt words."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " gold " and " tun ", the original meaning is (sword) not sharp.
humanum_full_description:
從「金」，「屯」聲，本義為（刀劍）不鋒利。《說文》：「錭也。从金，屯聲。」《韓非子‧顯學》：「水擊鵠雁，陸斷駒馬，則臧獲不疑鈍利。」

　　「鈍」也可表示遲鈍、笨拙。《漢書‧鮑宣傳》：「臣宣吶鈍於辭，不勝惓惓，盡死節而已。」

　　「鈍」還用作失利、不順利。漢揚雄《法言‧五百》：「眾人愈利而後鈍，聖人愈鈍而後利。」

　　文辭質樸也可稱為「鈍」。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧銘箴》：「魏文九寶，器利辭鈍。」
humanum_short_description: 從「金」，「屯」聲，本義為（刀劍）不鋒利。

①不鋒利，不快，引申爲不順利：這把刀真鈍。成敗利鈍。
②笨，不靈活：鈍滯(ａ．遲鈍呆滯；b．不鋒利)。遲鈍。愚鈍。拙嘴鈍舌。
③快利銳。

從「 金 」，「 屯 」聲，本義為（刀劍）不鋒利。《說文》：「錭也。从金，屯聲。」《韓非子‧顯學》：「水擊鵠雁，陸斷駒馬，則臧獲不疑鈍利。」 「 鈍 」也可表示遲鈍、笨拙。《漢書‧鮑宣傳》：「臣宣吶鈍於辭，不勝惓惓，盡死節而已。」 「 鈍 」還用作失利、不順利。漢揚雄《法言‧五百》：「眾人愈利而後鈍，聖人愈鈍而後利。」 文辭質樸也可稱為「 鈍 」。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧銘箴》：「魏文九寶，器利辭鈍。」
From the sound of " gold" and " tun", the original meaning is (sword) not sharp. "Shuowen": "Yeye. From Jin to Tunsheng." "Han Feizi·Xianxue": "Water hits the geese, and Lu breaks the horse, and then Zang gains unquestioned blunt profits." " Dull" can also mean dullness and clumsiness. "Han Shu·Bao Propaganda": "Chen Xuan Na is blunt in his speech, and it's too terrifying, just dead. " Dull" is also used for failure and unsuccessfulness. Han Yangxiong's "Fayan‧ Five Hundreds": "The more profitable the people, the more blunt, and the more blunt the saint, the more profitable. Plain speech can also be called " blunt". The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long·Ming Zhen": "Wei Wen Nine Treasures, sharp tools and blunt words."

dùn
вм. 钝
Radicals: 金, 屯  (gold, barracks)
Meaning Mnemonic
Make barracks out of gold and they will get dull quickly. Gold is soft, it's okay for jewelry and delicate things that aren't used much, but barracks for soldiers? Those are used constantly, and they get worn out easily. What was once shiny gold will go dull in days.
Picture a huge barracks made of dull, almost brown, gold. Maybe you should have picked a better material.
Reading Mnemonic
As you stare sadly at the dull barracks, the don (どん) shows up out of nowhere, and he's pissed. He turns his angry gaze toward you and says, "How did my barracks get so dull? Are you at fault? This is bad, this is very bad. Someone will pay for this."
You stand cowering in front of the don as he inspects how dull the gold barracks are. You don't wanna be off'd for this just because the don was dull enough to make you use gold!
